name: Analog & Mixed-Signal Circuits
description: Sector template for analog circuit patents including amplifiers, PLLs, ADC/DAC, and oscillators.
contextDescription: Analog circuit patents cover fundamental building blocks in all electronic systems. Key areas include amplifiers (H03F), PLLs and clock circuits (H03L), ADC/DAC converters (H03M), oscillators (H03B), and filters (H03H). High-value targets include Analog Devices, Texas Instruments, NXP, Qualcomm (RF), and all SoC vendors. Analog IP is critical for mixed-signal integration.
scoringGuidance: ADC/DAC patents are in every device with analog I/O - extremely broad applicability.
PLL patents are essential for clocking in all digital systems.
Low-power analog patents are critical for mobile and IoT devices.
RF analog patents (LNA, PA, mixer) target wireless device markets.
High-speed interface patents (SerDes) target data center and networking.

questions.question: What type of analog circuit does this patent cover? Score based on market ubiquity: 1-3 for specialized, 4-6 for common (filter, oscillator), 7-10 for fundamental (amplifier, ADC/DAC, PLL).
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the circuit type and assess its ubiquity in electronic systems.

questions.question: Does this patent improve key analog metrics (noise, linearity, bandwidth, power consumption)? These are critical differentiators.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify specific performance metrics improved by this patent.

questions.question: How suitable is this for integration in mixed-signal SoCs? Consider CMOS compatibility and digital interface.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Assess SoC integration potential and CMOS compatibility.

questions.question: Does this patent apply to RF/wireless circuits (LNA, PA, mixer, synthesizer)? RF commands premium IP licensing.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify RF applications and frequency ranges.
